biog.entry.name: PARRY, the Hon. Stephen Shane
biog.entry.description: Biography for PARRY, the Hon. Stephen Shane
biog.entry.title: Biography for PARRY, the Hon. Stephen Shane
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Senator for Tasmania
biog.entry.party.name: Liberal Party of Australia

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the Senate for Tasmania 2004 (term began 1.7.2005) and 2010.

parliamentary.positions.title: Parliamentary Positions
parliamentary.positions.para: Temporary Chair of Committees from 26.6.08 to 15.6.09.
Deputy President of the Senate from 4.7.11 to 7.7.14.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: Senate Standing: Selection of Bills from 12.9.06 to 4.7.11; Scrutiny of Bills from 23.3.07 to 11.2.08; Appropriations and Staffing from 9.5.07 to 1.7.14 and from 13.11.13 (Chair from 14.11.13); House from 9.5.07; Procedure from 20.6.07; Senators' Interests from 4.2.09 to 12.5.09; Publications from 12.3.09 to 11.11.13.

Senate Legislative and General Purpose Standing: Environment, Communications, Information Technology and the Arts from 11.9.06 to 12.2.07; Environment, Communications and the Arts from 12.2.08 to 24.11.08; Legal and Constitutional Affairs from 8.2.07 to 11.2.08; Legal and Constitutional Affairs: Legislation and References Committees from 11.3.10 to 1.7.11; Finance and Public Administration from 24.11.08 to 14.5.09; Finance and Public Administration: References Committee from 14.5.09 to 11.3.10.
Senate Select: Men's Health from 25.11.08 to 4.12.08; Cyber-Safety from 27.6.13 to 30.8.13.

Joint Statutory: Public Works from 11.8.05 to 17.10.07; Australian Commission for Law Enforcement Integrity from 23.3.07 to 1.7.14; Australian Crime Commission from 9.5.07 to 25.11.10; Law Enforcement from 25.11.10 to 1.7.14; Broadcasting of Parliamentary Proceedings from 9.5.07 to 11.3.08 and from 25.9.08 to 1.7.14.
Joint Standing: Migration from 1.7.05 to 17.10.07; Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade from 1.7.11 to 1.7.14; National Capital and External Territories from 4.7.11 to 7.7.14.

conf.delegations.visits.title: Conferences, Delegations and Visits
conf.delegations.visits.para: Member, Parliamentary Delegation to Belgium, the Netherlands and Norway, April-May 2006.
Member, ACC Delegation to Canada, USA, Italy, Austria, UK and the Netherlands, April-May 2009.
Member, Parliamentary Delegation to Singapore and Indonesia, July 2010.
Member, Parliamentary Delegation to Timor-Leste, March 2012.
Member, Parliamentary Delegation to Laos, October 2012.
Member, Parliamentary Delegation to the Philippines, February 2013.
Leader, Parliamentary Delegation to the United Arab Emirates and Switzerland, March 2014.
Official visit to Singapore and Malaysia, March 2015.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Deputy Government Whip in the Senate from 11.9.06 to 21.4.07.
Chief Government Whip in the Senate from 21.4.07 to 3.12.07.
Chief Opposition Whip in the Senate from 3.12.07 to 4.7.11.
Manager of Opposition Business in the Senate from 16.2.09 to 19.7.10.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: President, Liberal Party Cradle Coast Branch 1999-2005.
Chair, Liberal Party Braddon Federal Electorate 2000-02.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Certificate in Mortuary Science, Australian College of Funeral Service.
Master Funeral Director, Australian College of Funeral Service.
Member, Rotary Club of Ulverstone West from 1987; President 1992-93.
Member, Surf Lifesaving Australia; Chief Instructor, Burnie 1981-83; Club Captain, Ulverstone 1991-93
National President, Australian Funeral Directors Association 2001-03.
National Chairman, Australian College of Funeral Service 1999-2000.
National Deputy Chairman, Australian Institute of Embalming 1996-97.
President, Burnie Chamber of Commerce and Industry 2000-04.
Director, Tasmanian Chamber of Commerce and Industry 2000-04.
